Class FitnessTracker

java.lang.Object
FitnessTracker
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class FitnessTracker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
Author:
Ezra Uses Swing to create GUI This class contains all methods needed for the Calorie Calculator This class implements the ActionListener for the buttons in the GUI

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
    Observer design pattern Method that listens for button click Multiple if statements to identify which button was clicked Updates the values of workout and intensity Closes current window and opens timeWindow

    static FitnessTracker getInstance()  
    void resultsWindow()
    Gets called when "Confirm" button is clicked on second window Creates a new results window which displays the result of the calculation Multiple if blocks to check the kind of workout done
    void timeWindow​(java.lang.String t)
    Gets called when a button is clicked on the first window Creates a new window with a textField to input number of minutes

  • Method Details

    • calculateBike

      public double calculateBike​(double intensity, int time)
      Calculator for biking
      Parameters:
      intensity - -- the selected intensity of the exercise
      time - -- the duration of the exercise
      Returns:
      the calories burned Uses the formula for calories burned per minute while running Formula taken from https://captaincalculator.com/health/calorie/calories-burned-cycling-calculator/

    • resultsWindow

      public void resultsWindow()
      Gets called when "Confirm" button is clicked on second window Creates a new results window which displays the result of the calculation Multiple if blocks to check the kind of workout done

    • timeWindow

      public void timeWindow​(java.lang.String t)
      Gets called when a button is clicked on the first window Creates a new window with a textField to input number of minutes
      Parameters:
      t - - passes the value of the workout variable on Creates an anonymous class that implements ActionListener Anonymous class is needed to be able to use the button on the second window Try-catch block inside anonymous class to catch invalid input (non integers)`

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Observer design pattern Method that listens for button click Multiple if statements to identify which button was clicked Updates the values of workout and intensity Closes current window and opens timeWindow
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      public static FitnessTracker getInstance()
      Returns:
      instance of class for Singleton pattern
